name: $then
desc: Pass a ref to a function to call when this promise 'resolves'.The function will receive parameters:1) pResults (row)2) pExtraParams (row)3) pErrorText (char)4) pSuccess (boolean)If no $catch() method is passed, rejected promises will call this method, passing pErrorText and pSuccess=kFalse.Returns the promise itself, so you can chain a .$catch() call, for example.

pvardefs.name: pCallback
pvardefs.desc: Item reference to a callback method. Syntax should be of the form: "$cinst().$myMethod.$ref"

pvardefs.name: pExtraParams
pvardefs.desc: A row of extra params to pass to the 'then' function (will be the second param)

name: $catch
desc: Pass a ref to a function to call when this promise is 'rejected'.The function will receive parameters:1) pResults (row)2) pExtraParams (row)3) pErrorText (char)4) pSuccess (boolean)

pvardefs.name: pCallback
pvardefs.desc: Item reference to a callback method. Syntax should be of the form: "$cinst().$myMethod.$ref"

pvardefs.name: pExtraParams
pvardefs.desc: A row of extra params to pass to the 'then' function (will be the second param)

name: $resolve
desc: Resolve this promise, calling its 'then' function.

name: $reject
desc: Reject this promise, calling its 'catch' function.

name: $attachToWorker
desc: Attaches this promise to the given worker object as its $callbackinst.Uses a simple generic $completed handler, to just pass the given results row through to the 'then()' method.It will never fail, so should not be used for non-trivial situations.
